intro: Vernonanthura hieracioides, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine. Its resilience and unique appearance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
